summary: Ancient Sumer in Mesopotamia is considered the world's oldest civilization, dating back to around 4000 BCE. Civilizations are complex societies with unique features. These include cities, a system of writing, social classes, and advanced agriculture and technology. They often have a powerful ruling class and specialized jobs. The word 'civilization' comes from the Latin word for 'city.' Ancient Egypt is another early example. These societies developed from the Neolithic Revolution, a period of significant change in human history.
title: Civilization
